body:
I tried the patch from https://github.com/apache/hudi/pull/4203 but it still does not work for me.
The only difference is that I upsert data using SQL MERGE INTO statement.
I run my job in the AWS Glue - first job execution dumps data to S3 and creates table in Glue Data Catalog(BULK_INSERT). Then I add property(tried with serde and tbl properties) to Glue table `hoodie.datasource.write.keygenerator.consistent.logical.timestamp.enabled=true`, so the SQL command can read this property. But when I'm running upsert job, it still corrupts all the timestamps within the files that are being updated. 
@nsivabalan Could you help me with it, please?
@nsivabalan Changes look good. But `TestHoodieBackedMetadata.testMetadataMultiWriter()` is failing. Can yuu please check?

got it. So, w/o setting any multi-writer configs, are things working fine? 
Also, can you post the contents of .hoodie folder.

Let's try few things to see if we can unblock you and we can go from there.
- Try switching to "insert" or "upsert"
- Try removing all multi-writer configs and see what happens. 

btw, multi-writer had few bugs in 0.8.0. We fixed few bugs in 0.10.0. So, would recommend giving it a try with 0.10.0 if you are really looking to enable multi-writer.

nope, you don't need to set any schema explicilty. 
I went through all configs from the description. 

Guess there could be some typo
hoodie.deltastreamer.s3.source.queue.url is the right config. I see you are setting hoodie.deltastreamer.source.queue.url.

CC @codope
Closing this as we have a tracking jira. thanks!

@JB-data : Do you have any updates for us. Can you confirm that target schema you set is aligned with the output from after transformation? 
Can you also enable debug logs(for hudi) when you run your deltastreamer job and share w/ us.

@guanlisheng : I see your issue is slightly different, as you claim that you could able to get it working w/ one source, but not w/ jsonKafkaSource. Can you please file a new github issue w/ all details. we can take a look.

are you also facing this w/ 0.10.0 as well? interesting. I remember we made some fix towards NPE with commit metadata parsing during archival, looks like this is different. 
btw, while we triage the root cause, a bit hacky suggestion to get past the issue. From the commit metadata, I see this is an empty commit. No files were written as part of this commit. if its a PoC dataset, you can try deleting the commit meta file from timeline and restart your pipeline. (There should be 3 files in your timeline per commit (instant.commit.requested, instant.commit.inflight and instant.commit)
@codope gentle ping to assist here.
thanks!
sorry, I thought Yuwei is the author. looks like its nikenfls. lets wait for few more days to hear back from the original author.
@yihua : sure, thanks. do follow up and see how we can go about it. Do file a tracking jira to dump all findings so far. and may be make it a blocker so that we don't miss out.

@xushiyan @yihua : with sql-dml, how are timeline server instantiated? Is it the same flow as sparkdatasource. 
@yihua : Do we know if the timeline server is running in this case ? or is it the case of increasing the read timeouts. But from our local exp, timeline server was able to handle 90k+ requests per sec. So, likely its the case where timeline server is not reachable at all.

@xushiyan : Guess author is asking if we can achieve what MultiTableDeltaStreamer does using spark streaming. I don't think we have any readily available solution for this yet. 
@xuranyang : As raymond suggested, it would be a good addition to hudi feature set. Feel free to start a discussion or RFC around this.

By incremental field updates, do you mean partial field updates. I believe we have this functionality in sql-dml. But not sure on the flink. 
I will let danny speak for that. 
CC @xushiyan @YannByron

oh, just now noticed we have a PR put up already for the flink. I will go ahead and close the issue out for now. Feel free to continue discussions on the jira and PR. Or open up a new issue if you have any asks. thanks! @dik111
@Frogglet : gentle ping
@danny0405 : can we have some follow up here please. If its a feature request, can we file a tracking jira.
I will try it, but we not have a unique key
@Kavin88 : did you get a chance to try out the external config file.

Also, if you were able to get it working w/ Livy, consider adding a blog or a write up on how you went about it. Others in the community might benefit from your work. We can help with the write up if need be.
btw, savepoint and restore for MOR is added just few weeks back and so is available only from 0.11. But should work for COW for older releases too.
I will try to add more documentation around savepoint/restore to our website.

recently we also updated instructions on how to use hudi-cli for S3 dataset.
https://hudi.apache.org/docs/next/cli/
just incase you you interested.
@danny0405 @leesf : can you loop in someone to help.

@tieke1121 : Can you please respond to Danny's question above. Unless we have more info, its hard to debug. if you have got past the issue, please update us on how you get past it so that it can benefit others in the community.
feel free to close out the issue if you got it resolved btw.
I will let @codope follow up here. but when you query via hive, may I know what input format are you using? HiveInputFormat, or HoodieCombineHiveInputFormat.
@Cherry-Puppy : can we have any updates on your end. If you got the issue resolved, can we close the github issue.
@fengjian428 : gentle ping. Interested to know any progress. or if you got past the issue, how did you get it resolved.
@stym06 : can we have any updates on this regard please.
also, interested to know, why not enable hive sync along w/ deltastreamer configs.
Closing this due to inactivity. But please do share w/ which approach you went ahead with. We can add a faq so that others in the community can benefit.
Hi @jasondavindev do you have any issues with running 0.10.0 with EMR on EKS or it's straight forward and works with no issues?
@parisni : Did you get a chance to try it out. Let us know if you have any updates on this regard.
@t822876884 Do we have any follow ups here. if the issue is resolved, can we close the github issue.
@danny0405 @xushiyan : can we close out the github issue if the issue is resolved. If not, can we have some follow up please.

@nsivabalan I'm not specifying any input format when I query using Presto or Hive. I followed [these steps](https://hudi.apache.org/docs/query_engine_setup#hive) initially for Presto and Hive and it has always worked without the need to specify any input format.

Closing this as we have solution working. If you are still facing issues, feel free to re-open. or if you get past the issue by some other work around, do post it here so that it could benefit others in the community. thanks!

@danny0405 @Cherry-Puppy : Is there any follow up here. If not, can we close it out. Also, if we triaged any bugs, I assume its already upstreamed to open source. If not, highly recommend to upstream it to OSS.
@codope : I assume you are claiming that w/ HoodieCombineHiveInputFormat, you are seeing duplicated data (user reported that he/she is seeing duplicates w/ CombinedInputFormat).

@affei : not sure if this matters. But for a partitioned dataset, a pair of partition path and record key is unique for a given hudi table. So, there could be duplicate record keys in the output across diff partitions. Can you confirm that when you said you are seeing duplicates, you meant duplicate records having same value for both partition path and record keys.

If you wish to have globally unique record keys, you may have to choose one of the GLOBAL index options for index types.
Let us know if you have any more clarifications or asks. Closing it for now.
@BenjMaq : Do you have the driver logs when you triggered the alter table command. Don't think above stacktrace is useful at the moment.

@nsivabalan we have a usecase where we needed to do hudisync for a lot of tables, and when we were using sync in the deltastreamer, every job ended up creating jdbc connection pool with hive metastore that caused lots of connection timeout errors. so, i ended up rewriting a tool to do the sync for all tables in a loop that used the thrift client instead of jdbc. it currently runs on cron

@jdattani to print the exact key that cause the error, the logging level needs to be changed to `TRACE`. Atleast on EMR, you can do it via `/etc/spark/conf/log4j.properties` and changing `log4j.logger.org.apache.hudi=TRACE`. I am not sure about Glue though, how the logging level can be changed for Hudi. As far as Hudi job not failing, it seems like a critical issue. I would recommend you to open a ticket with AWS Support and they should re-direct it to the team. This is not the right forum to further debug this issue.

Sorry for the late reply, if you set ```hoodie.write.lock.dynamodb.table``` as a table that not exist, it would just create one and set the structure automatically. Or do you have to create the dynamodb lock table by yourself?

Hi, Any update on this PR? 

Just wondering if we are still on track to release this feature with Hudi `0.11` version.
@yihua : Can you assist here please.

Couple of observations. 
1. May I know why you are setting upsert parallelism to 15k. 15k is very high. Is that intentionally tuned. If not, would recommend to something like 200 to 300. 
2. I see your 2nd table has lot of file groups which were replaced. And so it does add some latency while checking valid file groups. So, once the cleaner comes through and deletes all replaced file groups, I feel the latency hit should go away. 

In general, do you know total file groups in table1 vs table2. If they are drastically different, then latency is expected to be different. 
CC @xushiyan @codope @yihua
@hudi-bot run azure

> @YannByron : can you review the patch.

LGTM.

> past
think this is cause by meta table,  I enabled metatable then got this error
I could able to reproduce w/ latest master. will investigate further.

@nsivabalan removing it seems to work. the problem I see is that performance looks significantly worse with it turned off. Do you have suggestions on how to speed up the ingest process? for background each day's worth of data we have roughly 4-5 billion records which is spatiotemporal data (lat, lon, timestamp with some identifier which are set to be the key)

Using straight spark `save` talkes roughly an hour, using the row write was about 20-30% slower and with it off is about 2-2.5x slower. I'll have to rerun some benchmarks to confirm actual numbers

Hi @nsivabalan I agree with your opinion that let cleaner delete files and partitions. Just a little concern that how can we deal with the scenario that we trigger a delete partition action with a **async** cleaner + enable metadata table. -> Async cleaner started and finished before replaced committed : 
1. Async cleaner finished to delete old replaced files.
2. Current replaced committed.
3. Meta table synced  ==> partitions are deleted in meta data table.

We maybe get different result between `getAllPartitions` form metadata table and number of physical partitions.
Also wen could have a strict limit that delete partition only works with sync cleaner but wondering to know if it is possible.
Or this kind of `out-of-sync` will cause no damage.

updated: we could let cleaner sync metadata table and delete partitions in it. It could solve the consistency issue.
Looks like this was fixed with https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HUDI-1776 on hudi 0.9 but is not backward compatible with tables that were previously renamed.
@guyuqi Have you verified that the Hudi table written by the sink can be successfully read?
@hudi-bot run azure
@yihua can this be merged also to docs for hudi 0.10? This change is only visible in 0.9.0 :)
@leesf : fixed the unintended changes.
if you can approve, I can land once CI succeeds.

I see another PR with kerberos support as well https://github.com/apache/hudi/pull/3771. May I know which is the right one. Can we close one of them if they are duplicates please.
@danny0405 : Are we waiting on something wrt this patch. Or is it good to review and take it to landing.
@zhedoubushishi : Can you address the feedback when you get a chance please.

> changes in general is good. just 1 nit. Can we try to see if we can leverage HoodieTestDataGenerator to write tests. you can do something like this dataGen.generateInserts : batch1 dataGen.generateUpdates : batch2 if not for allowDuplicates config set, total record count in snapshot view will be just batch1 records (assuming we updated all records from batch1) if config is set to true, total record count in snapshot view will be batch1 records + batch2 records. and you can do some assertions to ensure both batch of records are present.

OK, I'll try
Repeat submit

> @danny0405 : do we still need this or can be closed?

Still need this for 0.9.0 users.
since you have already put in time to write some tests, let already existing tests be there. may be in addition, give it a try.
@xushiyan @alexeykudinkin : another patch thats awaiting parquet upgrade.
Hi @nsivabalan and @yihua would you mind to take a look at your convince? Thanks a lot !
